descender noun [C]
(LETTER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
language
  specialized part of a written or typed letter that reaches lower than the bottom of a letter "x", for example the lower part of the letters "g", "p", or "y": It's important that the height of ascenders and descenders remains constant, or your font will look a mess. The name "Vermeer" has no descenders. Compare
ascender
More examplesFewer examplesIn early manuscripts, before the development of ascenders for letters such as "b", "d" and "h", and descenders for "p", "q", "y", and "z", many kinds of misreading are possible.The point size is the height of the type measured from the top of the tallest ascender to the bottom of the lowest descender.

descender noun [C]
(GOING DOWN HILL)
sports
  specialized a person who is going down a hill or slope, especially on a bicycle during a race: The best descenders exhibit almost suicidal bravery.
More examplesFewer examplesA fearless downhill rider can get two minutes ahead of a cautious descender in just 20 kilometres.The Tour de France has time-trialers, road specialists, climbers, descenders and sprinters all racing together.
